Hi @absolux, good to hear from you.

We ever think of something like `initExpress` before, but it violates the open/closed principle. We should not keep adding new methods to the bot:

```js
bot.initExpress(app)
bot.initKoa(app)
bot.initMirco(app)
bot.initRestify(app)

// for future?
bot.initFastify(app)
bot.initHapi(app)
```

However, we have a plan to separate server framework modules into individual libraries, for example, `bottender-express`, `bottender-koa`. And other frameworks also could be supported by this way.

Hi @CentaurWarchief !

Actually there is already `context.postMessage()` [at here](https://github.com/Yoctol/bottender/blob/master/src/context/SlackContext.js#L47-L61) but we didn't pass in the third argument for the underlying `messaging-api-slack`. The support of sending buttons can be easily achieved by pass in third argument, with maybe automatically stringify the `attachment` field or you have to manually do it as Slack need it to be a string. We can shortly made a patch for these.

For handling button callbacks, it's a bit more complicated since Slack send the button callbacks in an `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` request and the payload is a JSON string which is a lot different from the Events API. We need to change the server part and the request handling part to support this.
https://github.com/Yoctol/messaging-apis/releases/tag/v0.5.10

`with-botimize` => `analysis-botmize`
`with-chatbase` => `analysis-chatbase`
Nice, just note that don't forget to change link references in the docs.

The problem is that sometimes I don't have `text`. Just `attachments`. Not sure I can send `text: undefined` to skip the field and therefore, skip the validation: https://github.com/Yoctol/messaging-apis/blob/master/packages/messaging-api-slack/src/SlackOAuthClient.js#L241

What I would do is: 
```JS
context.postMessage({ text })
``` 

or: 

```JS
context.postMessage({ attachments: [] })
```

But I am not sure if this breaks any interface. The `channelId` would be implicitly set.

So, in regards to button callbacks and menus, isn't there any way I can catch those events and handle 'em myself? Doesn't need to be a custom bot API.

Ah, I missed that `text` is not required if only `attachments` is provided. I guess we'll need a modification to the arguments of `postMessage` for it to receive only `attachments`. (following in https://github.com/Yoctol/messaging-apis/issues/211)

For now (bottender@0.14.5), you may try
```js
context.postMessage('text')
context.sendText('text')
```
or
```js
context.postMessage(undefined, { attachments: [] })
```
, though I'm not sure how Slack server handles the no-text-requests.

For the button callbacks, you can just setup another server or another route in current server that accepts `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` request and handle it by yourself, then setup your Slack app's `Interactive Components` request URL to the new server/route.
But I think it should be handled as an `SlackEvent` so the bot logic can be integrated and I'm figuring it out now.

Hi @roonie007, are there any examples show that we will need to destroy some state values after fixed number steps?

IMO, we can explicitly `setState` or `resetState` after hearing something or receiving some events. 

For example:

```
- Hi Bottender
```

(one event)

And 

```
- Hi 
- Bottender
```

(two events)

Handling state according to what we heard seems better for conversational model.

We need a lot of work to make this useful and it cannot be an official example anytime soon.
